replies.body:
Calling people retards, saying they need mental help, flaming them all game?

Yeah, that can get you a permban if you do it a few times. Not acceptable in polite society, or impolite society for that matter.

> I called one guy a retard, only once.

That's still one time too many.

> When someone goes off on 4 people for absolutely no reason, it's toxic to tell them that they need mental help? You wouldn't tell someone that they need mental help if they pushed you around IRL for no reason?

Yes, it is toxic, as you're just going off on that one person for absolutely no reason, and now three other players have to deal with two flamers.

No, I wouldn't tell someone they need mental help - I'd tell them to step down. You seem to take things to illogical extremes, truth be told.

> EDIT: You've played the game for years and low silver is the highest you've scored and you hardly play any ranked. You're bad at the game and you can't understand the competitive spirit so your opinion on this is 100% irrelevant. Stay on the boards pretending to do something good.

First of all; player's rank doesn't matter. It doesn't matter if someone's Bronze V, Challenger, in-between, or have never played Ranked. They're still playing the same game as you, and their rank doesn't somehow make their comments/opinions irrelevant.

(Besides, if you're going to say his opinion is irrelevant because he's low-silver and hardly plays ranked, _maaaaaaybe_ you shouldn't be saying that from an unranked account? Just sayin'.)

Second; competitive spirit usually _stays in-line with the rules of the game you're playing_. If you're playing golf and you start cussing out someone for getting better scores than you, you're not being competitive, you're being an asshole. If you're playing Soccer and slug someone because they missed a kick, that's _also_ being an asshole.

Likewise, flaming your teammates, harassing them, calling them "retard" or "disgusting silver", etc. - _that's not competitive spirit. That's being an asshole._

> That's still one time too many.

You took it out of its context. He said "calling people retards" while the proof says i called one guy a retard, and everyone on that team did agree. 

> Yes, it is toxic, as you're just going off on that one person for "absolutely no reason", and now three other players have to deal with two flamers.

> No, I wouldn't tell someone they need mental help - I'd tell them to step down. You seem to take things to illogical extremes, truth be told.

So in no case would you tell someone they needed mental help cause it could break their poor little heart? I don't know what to tell you if you believe this. Acting like an innocent godsent angel that has never done anything remotely negative, laughable. 

Just cause you tell someone to step down if they push you around, doesn't mean the rest of the world has to react in the exact same way and that also doesn't make how others react differently wrong in any way. Your argument is sooo weak, trying to defend an automated system that solely bans people after curse words. 

> First of all; player's rank doesn't matter. It doesn't matter if someone's Bronze V, Challenger, in-between, or have never played Ranked. They're still playing the same game as you, and their rank doesn't somehow make their comments/opinions irrelevant.

> (Besides, if you're going to say his opinion is irrelevant because he's low-silver and hardly plays ranked, maaaaaaybe you shouldn't be saying that from an unranked account? Just sayin'.)

> Second; competitive spirit usually stays in-line with the rules of the game you're playing. If you're playing golf and you start cussing out someone for getting better scores than you, you're not being competitive, you're being an asshole. If you're playing Soccer and slug someone because they missed a kick, that's also being an asshole.

> Likewise, flaming your teammates, harassing them, calling them "retard" or "disgusting silver", etc. - that's not competitive spirit. That's being an asshole.

You wouldn't say this if you weren't gold 5 lmao. Rank matters in every way, it is easy to speak as you do when you're out of the game and not playing competitively. It's a competitive game and you're forced to co-operate with total strangers. It's only natural that people clash and argue. Who are you to say otherwise? 

Look, i really don't care about getting banned but please shut the fuck up if you came here to throw around useless arguments. The system is automated and nothing else can be said.

> You took it out of its context. He said "calling people retards" while the proof says i called one guy a retard, and everyone on that team did agree.

I'll care about the context when you can provide me with context where it's acceptable to call someone a retard.

> So in no case would you tell someone they needed mental help cause it could break their poor little heart?

I would potentially tell someone they needed mental help if, by my limited perception, they might actually need it.

I would not tell some random jerk that they need mental help because they're going out of their way to be an asshole to me.

I care _very little_ about the feelings of others, I just also don't care to break composure so easily.

If you can't make an argument without shoving words into another's mouth, you should probably re-evaluate the argument you're making, and if it should be made at all.

> Just cause you tell someone to step down if they push you around, doesn't mean the rest of the world has to react in the exact same way and that also doesn't make how others react differently wrong in any way. 

I expect people to handle things differently, but, as a society, responding to an asshole by being an even bigger asshole is usually met with hefty disapproval. If you start shouting someone down for so little as a push, you'd probably be punished for disturbing the peace.

> Your argument is sooo weak...

Believe it or not, people genuinely don't like flamers and rampant, toxic jerks.

> ...trying to defend an automated system that solely bans people after curse words.

Oh, please. I've said "fuck", "shit", "damn", "son of a bitch", and a good handful of other curses god knows how many times, and I've yet to receive a chat restriction. The IFS doesn't punish solely for curse words, it punishes people for negative, abusive chat. Hate speech and encouragements of self-harm being the rare exception.

> You wouldn't say this if you weren't gold 5 lmao. Rank matters in every way, it is easy to speak as you do when you're out of the game and not playing competitively. It's a competitive game and you're forced to co-operate with total strangers. It's only natural that people clash and argue. Who are you to say otherwise?

I'm disinclined to climb any higher than Gold V because I just want the Victorious Skin and its chromas. Regardless, I have plenty of room to talk about sportsmanlike behavior and the competitive spirit. To use your words; You're forced to co-operate with total strangers.

Which means abstain from arguing and clashing with your own teammates. Infighting is the surest way to lose, so your depiction of "competitive spirit" only serves to screw yourself over. Being negative is more likely to lose you games than being positive, so, let's leave with this;

Who wins more? The person who fights his own team, or the person who fights the opposing team? Do you win more by breaking your team down, or building them up?

Reply if you will, but, this will be my last response to you.
